text: Wanda Król also with surnames Gąsiewska or Błońska (born April 1946) is a Polish former long track speed skater, who was active in the 1960s and 1970s. Król represented her nation at the World Allround Speed Skating Championships for Women in 1966, finishing 30th overall. She also competed at other international competitions. She also competed at the World Sprint Speed Skating Championships in 1973, finishing 22nd overall. Furthermore, she competed at the European Speed Skating Championships for Women in 1970 (finishing 14th), 1972 (finishing 23rd) and 1973 (finishing 20th). Between 1963 and 1975 she competed ten times at the Polish Allround Championships, winning a total of three silver medals (1966, 1969, 1973) and two bronze medals (1970, 1972). After retirement of elite speed skating, she competed as master at the Polish nationals and World Championships for Masters in 1997. Many of her medals and other achievements are in the Museum of Sport and Tourism.Wiadomości Muzealne nr 70, Published on 2 October 2017, == Records== === Personal records === ==References== Category:1946 births Category:Place of birth missing (living people) Category:Date of birth missing (living people) Category:Polish female speed skaters Category:Living people
title: Wanda Król
